# xmrpeers

[![Lifecycle:
experimental](https://img.shields.io/badge/lifecycle-experimental-orange.svg)](https://lifecycle.r-lib.org/articles/stages.html)
[![R-CMD-check](https://github.com/Rucknium/xmrpeers/actions/workflows/R-CMD-check.yaml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/Rucknium/xmrpeers/actions/workflows/R-CMD-check.yaml)

`xmrpeers` is an alpha project. Expect breaking changes in future
versions.

## Installation

Install R. Linux users should install the `r-base` and `r-base-dev`
system packages.

You can install the development version of xmrpeers from
[GitHub](https://github.com/) if you have `git` and `curl` installed on
your system with:

``` r
install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("Rucknium/xmrpeers", upgrade = FALSE)
```

# Package index

## All functions

- [`as.subnet()`](as.subnet.md) : Convert IPv4 address to its subnet
- [`ban_list_v1`](ban_list_v1.md) [`ban_list_v2`](ban_list_v1.md) : IP
  ban list of suspected spy nodes
- [`compress.log()`](compress.log.md) : Extract and compress selected
  log lines
- [`gen.network()`](gen.network.md) : Generate a simulated Monero
  network
- [`get.p2p.log()`](get.p2p.log.md) : Parse p2p log files
- [`good_peers`](good_peers.md) : Reachable nodes' IP addresses
- [`in.ip.set()`](in.ip.set.md) : Check for IP inclusion in set of IP
  singletons and ranges
- [`newborn.nodes()`](newborn.nodes.md) : Print likely newborn nodes to
  the console
- [`peer.selection.collect()`](peer.selection.collect.md) : Collect peer
  selection draws
- [`peer.selection.test()`](peer.selection.test.md) : Test of whether
  peer selection deduplicates subnets
- [`peers.ip.collect()`](peers.ip.collect.md) : Collect connected peers'
  IP addresses
- [`ping.peers()`](ping.peers.md) : Ping peer nodes for latency
  measurement
- [`txpool.collect()`](txpool.collect.md) : Collect txpool archive data
- [`txpool.export()`](txpool.export.md) : Export txpool archive to CSV
- [`txpool.init()`](txpool.init.md) : Initialize txpool archive database
